title: Ring of hunger
data:
| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | hunger                                                        |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 100 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

A **ring of hunger** is a type of [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

9⁄10 of rings of hunger are generated cursed.

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") will never receive a ring of hunger as either of the two random rings in their starting inventory.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

The ring of hunger conveys the [hunger extrinsic](/wiki/Hunger_\(property\) "Hunger (property)"), which causes you to burn [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition") very quickly; every even-numbered [turn](/wiki/Turn "Turn") your nutrition is decremented, in addition to normal hunger and the [ring hunger](/wiki/Ring_hunger "Ring hunger") applied every 20 turns.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit 50084750](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/50084750c426c465e976b23c9a7f871a8950fae3), hunger prevents you from choking on food when [oversatiated](/wiki/Oversatiated "Oversatiated") by making you vomit, similar to [breathlessness](/wiki/Breathlessness "Breathlessness"), except that instead of draining 1000 nutrition, you are left with 60 nutrition.

## Strategy

The ring of hunger is not an *entirely* useless ring, but is only actively worn in rare circumstances. A non-cursed ring of hunger can be used to make room for a meal consisting of several large [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), such as those of various [giants](/wiki/Giant "Giant"), if you do not have an [amulet of magical breathing](/wiki/Amulet_of_magical_breathing "Amulet of magical breathing"). Outside of this scenario, the ring is primarily used as [polyfodder](/wiki/Polyfodder "Polyfodder").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The changes to the hunger property make the ring much more viable when eating several corpses for strength gain or other intrinsics.

### Identification

Dropping a ring of hunger into a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink") while another item is present on that square produces a unique message and removes that item. It is recommended to have a junk item that you can place on the sink whenever testing rings for this reason.

## History

The ring of hunger first appears in Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

In [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") and earlier versions, including variants based on those versions, the ring of hunger could be worn to lower nutrition quicker while wearing a [ring of sustain ability](/wiki/Ring_of_sustain_ability "Ring of sustain ability"), followed by removing the latter ring once you are weak from hunger, then eating to raise strength by one point (since being weak from hunger would normally lower your strength by 1). This is no longer possible in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1").

## Messages

- Suddenly, \<item> vanishes from the sink!

  You dropped a ring of hunger down a sink while another item was on its square.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), a cursed ring of hunger [named](/wiki/Name "Name") free action can be found within the Chamber of Junk in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict") can be created at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") by combining a ring of hunger and a [ring of aggravate monster](/wiki/Ring_of_aggravate_monster "Ring of aggravate monster").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 165](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L165)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1009](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L1009)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2813](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/eat.c#L2813)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ring of hunger

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
=
Name hunger
Appearance random
Base price 100 zm
Weight 3

A ring of hunger is a type of ring that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 SpliceHack
  • 7 References

Generation

9⁄10 of rings of hunger are generated cursed.

Wizards will never receive a ring of hunger as either of the two random rings in their starting inventory.[1][2]

Description

The ring of hunger conveys the hunger extrinsic, which causes you to burn nutrition very quickly; every even-numbered turn your nutrition is decremented, in addition to normal hunger and the ring hunger applied every 20 turns.[3]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

As of commit 50084750, hunger prevents you from choking on food when oversatiated by making you vomit, similar to breathlessness, except that instead of draining 1000 nutrition, you are left with 60 nutrition.

Strategy

The ring of hunger is not an entirely useless ring, but is only actively worn in rare circumstances. A non-cursed ring of hunger can be used to make room for a meal consisting of several large corpses, such as those of various giants, if you do not have an amulet of magical breathing. Outside of this scenario, the ring is primarily used as polyfodder.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The changes to the hunger property make the ring much more viable when eating several corpses for strength gain or other intrinsics.

Identification

Dropping a ring of hunger into a sink while another item is present on that square produces a unique message and removes that item. It is recommended to have a junk item that you can place on the sink whenever testing rings for this reason.

History

The ring of hunger first appears in Hack 1.21, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial item list for Hack 1.0.

In NetHack 3.6.0 and earlier versions, including variants based on those versions, the ring of hunger could be worn to lower nutrition quicker while wearing a ring of sustain ability, followed by removing the latter ring once you are weak from hunger, then eating to raise strength by one point (since being weak from hunger would normally lower your strength by 1). This is no longer possible in NetHack 3.6.1.

Messages

Suddenly, <item> vanishes from the sink!
You dropped a ring of hunger down a sink while another item was on its square.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, a cursed ring of hunger named free action can be found within the Chamber of Junk in the Lawful Quest.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, a ring of conflict can be created at a furnace by combining a ring of hunger and a ring of aggravate monster.

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 165
  2. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1009
  3. ↑ src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2813
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Ring_of_hunger&oldid=158740"

A '''ring of hunger''' is a type of [[ring]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
{{frac|9|10}} of rings of hunger are generated cursed.

[[Wizard]]s will never receive a ring of hunger as either of the two random rings in their starting inventory.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|165|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|1009|nethack=3.6.7}}

==Description==
The ring of hunger conveys the [[Hunger (property)|hunger extrinsic]], which causes you to burn [[nutrition]] very quickly; every even-numbered [[turn]] your nutrition is decremented, in addition to normal hunger and the [[ring hunger]] applied every 20 turns.{{refsrc|src/eat.c|2813|nethack=3.6.7}}

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|As of {{commit|50084750c426c465e976b23c9a7f871a8950fae3}}, hunger prevents you from choking on food when [[oversatiated]] by making you vomit, similar to [[breathlessness]], except that instead of draining 1000 nutrition, you are left with 60 nutrition.}}

==Strategy==
The ring of hunger is not an ''entirely'' useless ring, but is only actively worn in rare circumstances. A non-cursed ring of hunger can be used to make room for a meal consisting of several large [[corpse]]s, such as those of various [[giant]]s, if you do not have an [[amulet of magical breathing]]. Outside of this scenario, the ring is primarily used as [[polyfodder]].

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|The changes to the hunger property make the ring much more viable when eating several corpses for strength gain or other intrinsics.}}

===Identification===
Dropping a ring of hunger into a [[sink]] while another item is present on that square produces a unique message and removes that item. It is recommended to have a junk item that you can place on the sink whenever testing rings for this reason.

==History==
The ring of hunger first appears in Hack 1.21, a variant of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial item list for [[Hack 1.0]].

In [[NetHack 3.6.0]] and earlier versions, including variants based on those versions, the ring of hunger could be worn to lower nutrition quicker while wearing a [[ring of sustain ability]], followed by removing the latter ring once you are weak from hunger, then eating to raise strength by one point (since being weak from hunger would normally lower your strength by 1). This is no longer possible in [[NetHack 3.6.1]].

==Messages==
{{message|Suddenly, <item> vanishes from the sink!|You dropped a ring of hunger down a sink while another item was on its square.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], a cursed ring of hunger [[name]]d free action can be found within the Chamber of Junk in the [[Lawful Quest]].

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], a [[ring of conflict]] can be created at a [[furnace]] by combining a ring of hunger and a [[ring of aggravate monster]].
